name: Tommy Tronic (itch)
description:
This game was the very first one that I ever made, and has been lying on my hard drive for 10+ years now!! 

It's a bit old and I could have made the art a lot better, but I think that some gamers out there might still enjoy it.  It has its own somewhat clumsy charm, and is quite a nice adventure when you get into it.  I would love to remake this today.  So who knows?  If enough people encourage me I may even create a much better version!  It's definitely on my 'To-Do' list!

It's not  a platformer that you rush through though so take it easy.  You will have quite a tactical battle on your hands. Keys are limited and you need to find 3 types - Metal for metal doors, Wood for wooden doors & Tech keys for the later tech doors. 

Doors open automatically if you have a correct key in your rucksack - simply run into the door.

Your Rucksack is important too, as you only have 5 spaces, and so you may have to drop an item to make room for another - you decide ;)

Screen sizes are not fully supported as it's so old, and so the game may appear slighty 'letter-boxed'. It won't affect the game in any way.

Oh and the game is fully unlocked - you can choose any level to play, though it's obviously better if you follow the storyline as it will make more sense as you progress.

Well that's it - I hope some gamers out there enjoy Tommy Tronic and taking a nostaligic trip back to the old days.

All funds go towards convincing me to make a really kick ass remake :)

Let me know your thoughts!

-----------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------

Controls can be set to your tastes via the menu:

Standard keys are:

Move/Jump: arrow keys

To collect an item for your Rucksack you must crouch while standing over it, automatically adding it to your inventory.

Use an item in your rucksack (max 5 items so choose/use wisely): space bar

Cycle through rucksack '[' &']' keys

To drop an item from your Rucksack, make sure it is visible in your Rucksack Panel and then press "d"

Toggle weapons: '<' & '>' keys

You can see which control keys are set by pressing: 'h' (change them in the menu)

Joypad: If your Joypad is detected you can change the control settings in the controls screen. Move the mouse pointer (using the mouse) over a key option and press or move the desired button or stick to register it as your desired control binding.
